intro: Laetia glabra, commonly known as the smooth laetia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Laetia glabra is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
